sense.name: inhale and exhale smoke from cigarettes, cigars, pipes
sense.examples: We never smoked marijuana. Do you smoke?

sense.name: emit smoke
sense.examples: The fire smoked horribly with all that wet wood.

sense.name: cure or cook foods using smoke
sense.examples: With hickory wood as his smoke source, he smoked the pods at 110 degrees for three days. Ray usually smokes three salmon fillets at a time.

sense.name: conquer or surpass
sense.examples: Fortunately she smoked the exam on the retry the following spring. The senior didn't just win the race, he smoked the field by 4 seconds.

sense.name: SMOKE OUT: drive out with smoke
sense.examples: The fire smoked out the mice. We smoked out the bees. So the noxious fumes smoked out the tenants in the residential suite upstairs.
